segments.text: I can't believe what I'm seeing in this kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There's water everywhere, and the woman drying dishes doesn't even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is in the water, but she just keeps polishing that plate like nothing's wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy on that wobbly stool, reaching for the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's going to fall and hurt himself, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie, completely unaware of the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the open window and the peaceful garden outside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like a completely different world out there compared to the chaos in here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman must be really tired or distracted to miss all this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But that's no excuse for not noticing the water or the kids' risky behavior.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the stacked dishes next to the sink, waiting to be dried.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she'll ever finish them at this rate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone needs to shake her out of her daze before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
